executive chairman,`` a lot of my time'' will be devoted to dealing with regulators and other government officials, Eric Schmidt said.`` We've got very complicated government issues,'' he said, adding that we move quickly, and we tend to be disruptive at scale. European Union officials opened a formal antitrust probe last year into Google search results, while in China the company opted to shut down its mainland search engine rather than censor results for user queries.

Indiana Mike Pence will not run for president in 2012. AP Photo/Carlos Osorio Indiana Mike Pence will not run for president but has left the door open to running for governor of the Hoosier State in 2012. In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana, Mike Pence said in a Mike Pence has been publicly mulling whether to run for the open governor's office or for president for several months. will be focusing on the deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relations, government outreach and technology thought leadership. In addition, he will be serving as an advisor to both Larry Page and Sergey Brin . We are confident that this focus will serve Google and our users well in the future. Larry Page , Sergey Brin and I have worked exceptionally closely together for over a decade-- and we anticipate working together for a long time to come, Eric Schmidt said. This announcement was released in conjunction with the company's fourth quarter and fiscal year 2010 results. of Evansville political science professor. If Mike Pence is to encounter any bumps at all, they could come early, as he shifts his focus from federal to state issues, Robert Dion said. In some cases, it can be an awkward transition, to go from being a lawmaker to an executive, and to go from the federal level to the state level. There's going to be that transition that might have a few hiccups to it, he said.`` But he's familiar with all the issues, he's an energetic campaigner, he's got solid conservative credentials, he knows how to raise money.''
